p: The mechanisms by which acute inflammation affect the risk of vascular events include the following: endothelial dysfunction, procoagulant state, and inflammatory changes in atherosclerotic plaques [ 39, 40]. It is also known that persistent systemic inflammatory activity is a risk of factor for cardiovascular disease, and higher interleukin-6 blood levels increase cardiovascular mortality at one year after pneumonia infection [ 41]. This systemic inflammatory response can be reduced by vaccination [ 13]. When estimating the cost and benefit of interventions to prevent pneumonia, the association of pneumonia with cardiovascular disease risk should also be considered [ 40].
